page.title: 15WESTER ULSTON
page.content: This farm is owned by the Lauder family,and is about 400 acres.It is worked by Jimmy the father and three sons.At present they have 250 fattening cows--Galloways,Herefords and Angus.These are bought locally about a year old,and are sold before they are two at Edinburgh,eight at a time. The main crop is barley.Winter barley(100acres)is to sell as feeding and the Spring barley(110 acres)is for feeding or malting if good enough. About 50 acres of turnips are grown for the sheep and 50 acres of hay. In {October}they will have about 1000 lambs for fattening on the turnips and will be sold in Edinburgh in Spring.They also grow 60 acres of wheat for milling as flour. The farm has three {John Deere } tractors and a smaller one for feeding purposes.
